newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian ATX ends off, more losses seen ahead.
newsitem.headline: Austrian ATX ends off, more losses seen ahead.

text.p: Austrian shares trudged lower on Friday, coming under pressure from Germany and weakness in market heavyweights, and traders said it was possible the ATX index could fall to 1,200 points next week.
"The market was driven lower today by market heavyweights," said one trader. Yesterday's reversal by Wall Street had also contributed to uncertainty in the market, he noted.
"I think we will see further correction on Monday, possibly even below 1,200," said another trader.
The ATX fell 9.06 points or 0.75 percent to 1,206.21. Among its constituents four shares rose, 16 fell and one was unchanged.
The session's top gainer was high-grade steelmaker Boehler-Uddeholm, adding 3.53 percent to 882 schillings.
Luxury hosiery maker Wolford led the losers, shedding 2.23 percent to 1,270 schillings.
The May ATX future tumbled 13.5 points to 1,196.2. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 257
